# OpenClaw Cortex

> Hybrid semantic memory system for AI agents â€” vector search, smart capture, multi-factor recall

OpenClaw Cortex gives AI agents persistent, semantically searchable memory across sessions. It combines file-based structured memory (markdown, git-backed) with vector-based semantic memory (Qdrant) for compaction-proof recall.

## Core Capabilities

- **Semantic Search**: Vector similarity search over all memories via Qdrant gRPC
- **Smart Capture**: LLM-powered extraction of structured memories from conversations (Claude Haiku)
- **Classification**: Auto-categorization into rules, facts, episodes, procedures, preferences
- **Multi-Factor Recall**: Ranking by similarity, recency, frequency, type priority, and scope
- **Token Budgeting**: Fit recalled memories within configurable token limits
- **Deduplication**: Cosine similarity-based duplicate detection (threshold: 0.92)
- **Lifecycle Management**: TTL expiry, session decay, consolidation
- **OpenClaw Integration**: Pre/post-turn hooks for seamless agent memory

## Tech Stack

- Go 1.25+, Qdrant (gRPC), Ollama (nomic-embed-text, 768-dim), Claude Haiku, Cobra CLI, Viper config

## Quick Start

```bash
task docker:up                # Start Qdrant
ollama pull nomic-embed-text  # Pull embedding model
task build                    # Build binary
openclaw-cortex index --path ~/.openclaw/workspace/memory/
openclaw-cortex search "how to deploy"
openclaw-cortex recall "database schema question" --budget 2000
```
